you can use unetbootin
http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/
you can use your own iso. just download the regular ubuntu iso file and use unetbootin with that to make a live usb
Does this work on a sandisk cruzer usb?
as long as your usb is formated correctly, it will work on any usb drive :P
also don't fllood the channel. have some patience. :P
your usb drive should be formated as fat32
windows has disk tools to do that
most likely it already is fat32. use the disk tools on windows to check
then open unextbootin and choose the ubuntu iso file, and choose your usb device. then run it
you can put some space down for preserving stuff between boots. if you reboot with the usb plugged in, it should boot up ubuntu. if not, change your bios settings
go into bios and then choose boot disc usb
